author: SkäggPetter
post_text: October 7, 2015 at 9:39 PM#1Hi I'm wondering if its possible to create a macro that can scroll down in my group poollike macro one scrolls to grope 1-50 macro 2 scrolls down to 51-100Best Regards

posts.author: SkäggPetter
posts.post_text: October 7, 2015 at 9:39 PM#1Hi I'm wondering if its possible to create a macro that can scroll down in my group poollike macro one scrolls to grope 1-50 macro 2 scrolls down to 51-100Best Regards

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: October 7, 2015 at 9:52 PM#2As far as I know, scrolling in windows is not doable via command line. However, do it manually once, storing views at strategic points, and then the views will be recallable via macro.

posts.author: SkäggPetter
posts.post_text: October 7, 2015 at 10:04 PM#3alright  thank you for your quick  response/Petter

posts.author: Duplicate cedric-e
posts.post_text: October 21, 2015 at 7:39 AM#4Hello,I think you can use a command like pagedown.By using 1 command as pagedown your screen will scroll 1/2 down. To scroll 1 screen down you need 2 pagedown commands following each other.For the correct CMD try some different combinations.I don't have a desk/pc with me.

title: Group scroll
